articles.description: Watch live coverage of the Olympics 2024 Rugby Sevens Men's Pool Phase plus latest Olympic news and Team GB updates.
articles.title: Olympics 2024 LIVE: Watch Rugby Sevens plus latest Olympic news and Team GB updates

articles.description: Former marathon world champion Paula Radcliffe says she is "very sorry" after wishing a convicted rapist competing at the Olympics the "best of luck".
articles.title: Paula Radcliffe apologises for wishing convicted rapist luck at Olympics

articles.description: Simone Biles lands a spectacular vault in Paris training to make a huge statement in a low-pressure return to the Olympic stage.
articles.title: Simone Biles makes Olympic return with podium training at Paris 2024

articles.description: Captain Ben Stokes says opportunities for fast bowlers will come “naturally” after England name an unchanged team for the third Test against West Indies on Friday.
articles.title: England v West Indies: Ben Stokes says bowlers' opportunities will come 'naturally'

articles.description: Andy Murray withdraws from the singles in the Olympics but will play doubles in what will be the final event of his career.
articles.title: Paris 2024: Andy Murray out of Olympic singles but will play doubles

articles.description: BBC Sport takes you on a visual journey of the Olympic Games, from the early history of the events to the biggest moments and greatest athletes to take part.
articles.title: The Olympics: A visual guide to the history and story of the Games

articles.description: Seven-time Olympic swimming champion Caeleb Dressel says he is not confident rivals are not doping at the Paris Olympics.
articles.title: Paris 2024 Olympics: Caleb Dressel has fears over doping amid ongoing row

articles.description: Michael Palfrey could face punishment after he said he hopes South Korean swimmer Kim Woo-min wins the 400m freestyle gold in Paris.
articles.title: Paris 2024: Australian Olympic swimming coach faces punishment after backing Korea's Kim Woo-min

articles.description: Novak Djokovic, Simone Biles and Noah Lyles are among the biggest names in Paris 2024.
articles.title: Who are the big global stars at Paris 2024?

articles.description: Ireland reduce Zimbabwe from 121-1 to 210 all out to finish day one of the first Test match in Belfast in a strong position.
articles.title: Ireland v Zimbabwe: Hosts on top in historic Test at Stormont
